* The etymology of "là" is uncertain, but it may be derived from the Latin demonstrative pronoun "ille". * The etymology of "largo" is Germanic, but the exact Proto-Germanic word from which it is derived is unknown. * The etymology of "Giovanna" is Hebrew, as it is the Italian form of the Hebrew name יוֹחָנָה (Yokhanah).

| Italian | Derived | Etymology | |---|---|---| | oh | | | | dire | | | | io | | | | lui | | | | per | | | | il | | | | vostro | | | | paese | | | | già | | | | mai | | | | non | | | | essere | | | | ma | | | | dove | | | | si | | | | dimorare | | | | per | | | | tutto | | | | Europa | | | | che | | | | egli | | | | non | | | | essere | | | | palese | | |
